page.title: 11Salmon Fishing
page.content: SALMON PUTTS ARE COMMON ALONG THE BANKS OF THE RIVER SEVERN AT AWRE.THESE ARE LINES OF BASKETS FACING UPSTREAM TO CATCH THE FISH.THEY ARE OWNED BY LOCAL FARMERS AS AN EXTRA SOURCE OF INCOME.THE BIGGEST SALMON FISHERMEN IN AWRE IS MR CHRISTOPHER CADOGAN,WHOSE FAMILY HAVE BEEN IN THE BUSINESS FOR TWO HUNDRED YEARS.NOW HE HAS TO PAY A LICENCE FEE TO THE WATER AUTHORITY AND FISHES FOR THREE MONTHS IN EARLY SUMMER.THE BASKETS ARE INSPECTED TWICE A DAY AT LOWTIDE,EVEN IN THE NIGHTIME SO THAT THE FISH ARE SOLD FRESH.HE SELLS HIS FISH TO LOCAL PUBS AND RESTAURANTS.HE HAS NO SHORTAGE OF CUSTOMERS.THERE IS SOME TROUBLE WITH POACHERS AND THE LOCAL POLICEMEN RUNS MORE REGULAR PATROLS IN THE SUMMER.THE NUMBER OF FISH CAUGHT HAS DROPPED BY HALF IN THE LAST TEN YEARS.
